q: Google announced Thursday that co-founder Larry Page , pictured in 2007, would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman and focus on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. The firm's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , will work on strategic projects and new products, Google said in a statement. It said the management changes would take effect on April 4.

Roger Goodell today, and Roger Goodell wasn't referring to Michael Vick 's Pro Bowl 2010 season. Instead, Roger Goodell was talking about the way Michael Vick has handled himself off the field since being released from prison. We're looking for success stories, Roger Goodell said.
